etymologies: 1960s: acronym from light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation, on the pattern of maser

definitions: a device that generates an intense beam of coherent monochromatic light (or other electromagnetic radiation) by stimulated emission of photons from excited atoms or molecules. Lasers are used in drilling and cutting, alignment and guidance, and in surgery; the optical properties are exploited in holography, reading bar codes, and in recording and playing compact discs.
shortDefinitions: device that generates intense beam of coherent monochromatic light

definitions: treat or remove (something) using a laser, especially as part of surgery

examples.text: he has had tattoos lasered off his chest
I've got to get my eyes lasered again

shortDefinitions: treat or remove using a laser
